values.value: Suspended scaffolding system suspension lines require anchorages capable of supporting the gross weight of the loaded device multiplied by a Safety Factor of 4 Each occupant of a suspended scaffolding system must utilize their own Vertical Lifeline system, connected to an anchorage capable of supporting a static load of 5,000lbs. CFR 1910.28 (g)
Have the anchors for all suspended scaffolding system suspension lines and separate vertical lifelines been verified?
